ygData.subject: Re: Why did you choose to play a paladin?
ygData.msgSnippet: I started my paladin after playing a dark elf necromancer for a little while.  I guess it seemed logical to me to balance my evil character with a good one.
ygData.messageBody:
I started my paladin after playing a dark elf necromancer for a little
while. I guess it seemed logical to me to balance my evil character
with a good one. Just to let everyone know I do nice things with my
necromancer sometimes too. Last night I was in the Qeynos catacombs
invisible and came across a naked guy lost in the catacombs. I assumed
he had died and asked if this was so. He just didn't have any stuff yet
so I gave him some cloth armor and 5gp to get him started. Random acts
of kindness have helped me at various times.

Anyhow, I have always liked the idea of playing a holy knight and
paladins get some great combat skills/strengths. Something to remember
though is the game is balanced pretty well, so try out some other
combinations. I have:

a level 12 barbarian warrior - tank 360hps
a level 10 dark elf necromancer - fun for soloing
a level 6 high elf enchanter - created for jewelcraft
a level 5 dwarven cleric - fun to help people and dwarves are tough
fighters too
a level 5 wood elf ranger - tracking is really really neat
and of course my level 4 human paladin - the good guy fighter, fun to
help with lay hands

have fun!
shawn


-----Original Message-----
From: Kevin Runde [mailto:krunde@...]
Sent: Sunday, May 09, 1999 12:01 PM
To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Why did you choose to play a paladin?


From: Kevin Runde <krunde@...>

Why? Why not?

First there are the game advantages to Paladins:
Paladins are great fighters. Paladins get healing spells. Awesome
special
ability (Lay Hands). Finally, Verant claims we will get the best magical
weapons.

Now the role-playing advantages:
Paladins are trusted me more people. You get to play the hero, saving
people
and dying for a good cause.

The only thing I don't like it that it takes me longer to gain a level.
BUT
since people like and trust me as a paladin I find it easier to group
and
thus I have actually gained levels faster.

Hort, Dwarven Paladin, Bertoxxulous Server

> Hail all!!!!! This is a question posed to everyone who has subscribed
to
> this list. Why did you choose to play a paladin? No matter your
reasons,
> share them with us. Hopefully everyone here is mature enough not to
flame
> people for their reasons and what not.
